page.title: 12EDUCATION 2
page.content: Loddiswell School, housed as it is in a very old building, with no nearby school field for easy access for games and environmental work, is quite hard pressed to provide with ease the wide curriculum that is expected of primary schools today.It tries to compensate. Each week the top class travels by bus to Kingsbridge Sports Centre for games. The school has had its own learners swimming pool and achieves 100% success. Much use of 'helpful' mothers has been made to widen the curriculum; Craft, Art, Cookery etc. The Parent-Teachers Association has done much to help provide much needed educational equipment. Staffing:-Teachers: Head and two full- time and one part-time. Ancilliary: Caretaker, Cook, Kitchen Helper, two Mealtime Assistants, part-time Secretary and Road Crossing Patrol.
